meanings.definition: Possible to do easily or conveniently.
meanings.sent1: Fixing the leaky faucet was feasible for the handyman.
meanings.sent2: It is feasible to finish the project by the end of the week.
meanings.sent3: It seemed feasible to teach the cat to do tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to travel the world was as feasible as flying to the moon.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a self-cleaning house sounded feasible and exciting.

meanings.definition: Capable of being accomplished or brought about.
meanings.sent1: With hard work, winning the competition is feasible.
meanings.sent2: The team believed that winning the game was feasible.
meanings.sent3: It was feasible for the dog to learn how to skateboard.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a pilot felt as feasible as reaching the stars.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time travel in movies is not scientifically feasible.
